com.navis.framework.persistence

Class HiberCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.navis.framework.persistence.HiberCache
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IDetailedDiagnostics

    public class HiberCache
extends java.lang.Object
implements IDetailedDiagnostics
    A singleton that caches the Hibernate metadata in a format useful to us.

    todo: rip this out eventually as we should just use hibernate session factories directly and metafield dictionary where needed. Not to beat a dead horse but if fully qualified entity name had been used as suggested- there is no need for most of these custom maps.

    • Method Detail

      • reload

        public static void reload()
        Reloads HiberCache

      • newInstanceForEntity

        public static Entity newInstanceForEntity(java.lang.String inEntityName)
        Instantiates a new instance of a persisted entity.

        Uses a cached map to lookup entity Class.

        Parameters:
        inEntityName - short name for the entity, e.g. "BaseUser"
        Returns:
        new instance of entity

      • entityName2EntityClass

        public static java.lang.Class entityName2EntityClass(java.lang.String inEntityAlias)
        Translates entity name to entity class
        Parameters:
        inEntityAlias - for example "BaseUser", also supports fully qualified class name
        Returns:
        Java class for BaseUser, i.e. the class com.navis.security.business.user.BaseUser

      • getEntityAliasUsedForAuditFields

        @Deprecated
public static java.lang.String getEntityAliasUsedForAuditFields(java.lang.Class inPersistentClass)
        Deprecated. this API is used only in forming field names for audit columns Created/Creator/Updated/Updater The hibercache in the value from the method name of the setter. We should abolish this altogether
        Given a persistent class, return our standard abbreviated name for it (the "alias").
        Parameters:
        inPersistentClass - persistent class
        Returns:
        Entity Alias of the PARENT CLASS!!! That was probably not Jon's intention but all the other audit columns now expect this behavior.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        entity alias

      • getEntityNameForField

        public static java.lang.String getEntityNameForField(java.lang.String inFieldId)

        Given our field ID, return the name of the Entity to which the field belongs NOTE: this method does not know how to handle fields of HibernatingComponent classes, in which case it will return null!
        Parameters:
        inFieldId - metafield id
        Returns:
        entity name

      • property2String

        public static java.lang.String property2String(MetafieldId inMetafieldId,
                                               java.lang.Object inValue)
        Converts the value of a property to a String representation suitable for persistance. This is useful for classes that need to persist a polymorphic value.

        Special Case, new 2005-10-13: If inValue is a String starting with '&', then no conversion is performed. This is used to define substitution parameters in our Predicates.

        Parameters:
        inMetafieldId - metafield id
        inValue - object
        Returns:
        converted string
        See Also:
        property2String(com.navis.framework.metafields.MetafieldId, Object), SavedPredicate

      • string2Property

        public static java.lang.Object string2Property(MetafieldId inMetafieldId,
                                               java.lang.String inPersistedString)
        Inverse of property2String.
        Parameters:
        inMetafieldId - metafield id
        inPersistedString - persisted string for the field
        Returns:
        converted object
        See Also:
        property2String(com.navis.framework.metafields.MetafieldId, Object), SavedPredicate
